channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Predictive Maintenance Proving Out as Successful AI Use Case
item.description: By John P. Desmond, AI Trends Editor More companies are successfully exploiting predictive maintenance systems that combine AI and IoT sensors to coll...

item.title: Symbotic acquires OhmniLabs, maker of disinfection & telepresence robots
item.description: With the acquisition of OhmniLabs, Symbotic said it will be better positioned to expand its capabilities for supply chain customers. The post Symbotic...

item.title: OpenAI confirms new frontier models o3 and o3-mini
item.description: OpenAI has just confirmed that is releasing new reasoning models named o3 and o3-mini, successors to the o1 and o1-mini models.

item.title: Novelty In The Game Of Go Provides Bright Insights For AI And Autonomous Vehicles
item.description: By Lance Eliot, the AI Trends Insider We already expect that humans to exhibit flashes of brilliance. It might not happen all the time, but the act it...

item.title: From AI to humanoids: top robotics trends of 2024
item.description: The Robot Report Podcast reflects on the successes and challenges that defined the robotics industry in 2024. The post From AI to humanoids: top robot...

item.title: ‘I worked hard for my savings’: I’m 71 and a retired teacher. I want to give my kids money — but my daughter spends lavishly and my son is wealthy.
item.description: “I have been reading about the idea of giving your children money when they need it the most, rather than waiting until you die.”

item.title: ‘She has two financially stable children’: Does it make sense for my wealthy mother, a recent widow, to take out a $100,000 life-insurance policy?
item.description: “It was generous of our mom to offer.”

item.title: Large language overkill: How SLMs can beat their bigger, resource-intensive cousins
item.description: Whether a company begins with a proof-of-concept or live deployment, they should start small, test often and build on early successes.

item.title: ‘She is single and has a low-wage job’: I want to give my daughter, who is in her 30s, $50,000 for retirement. What could go wrong?
item.description: “She can invest aggressively, as she has over two decades to see her principal grow.”

item.title: Hugging Face shows how test-time scaling helps small language models punch above their weight
item.description: Given enough time to "think," small language models can beat LLMs at math and coding tasks by generating and verifying multiple answers.

item.title: New research analyzes safety of Waymo robotaxis

item.title: ‘I’m betting on another 22 spins around the sun’: I’m 65 and have $3.9 million. How much should I realistically spend on a house?
item.description: “I have zero debt, no upcoming tax liabilities and no inheritance on the horizon.”

item.title: I was laid off. I’m 43 and my husband is 35. I have $8,000 in credit-card debt and our mortgage is $1,600 a month. What do we do?
item.description: “We have been bringing in $60,000 a year for the last couple years, until this October, when I was laid off.”

item.title: Arm lawsuit against Qualcomm ends in mistrial and favorable ruling for Qualcomm
item.description: Qualcomm did not violate a license with Arm when it acquired Nuvia for $1.4 billion, in a ruling by a jury today.

item.title: Perplexity’s Carbon integration will make it easier for enterprises to connect their data to AI search
item.description: With the acquisition of Carbon, Perplexity will expand the knowledge pool powering its AI search engine, making its responses more relevant.
